Text saved: Carol Dweck is a person who studies the mind. She talks about a 'growth mindset'. A growth mindset means you believe you can learn and get better. You think your brain can grow.

She says our brain can change. We can learn new skills and talents. Maybe we are not good at them at first. Many people often praise the final result. Or they praise natural talents. For example, they say, "You are good at seeing small things." Or, "You are good at planning parties."

But studies show something different. It is better to praise *how* people do things. Praise their hard work. Praise when they try new things. Praise how they fix problems. This helps people learn new skills. It helps them get better at things they already do.
Feedback received: Grade 3/10 - FAIL
